marketNews.title: OCBC & CIMB Reported Interested in Acquiring PNBN
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd. (OCBC Singapore) and CIMB Group Holdings Bhd. (CIMB Malaysia) are competing to acquire the controlling shares of Bank Pan Indonesia (PNBN). Reuters sources said OCBC Singapore and CIMB Malaysia have submitted a non‑binding offer for the shares offered by ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. and the Gunawan family, with the offer expected to expire this month. In addition to OCBC Singapore and CIMB Malaysia, Reuters also mentioned that Maybank Group Malaysia, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC) are interested in buying PNBN. PNBN has not commented on the issue, while OCBC Singapore, CIMB Malaysia, Maybank Malaysia, MUFG, and SMBC declined to comment. Previously, Bloomberg and Reuters reported that the Gunawan family and ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. were considering selling their ownership in PNBN. Together they own 85.74% of PNBN shares, with the Gunawan family holding 46.52% and ANZ holding 39.22%. The combined value of their shares was approximately IDR 39 trillion based on the market close on Tuesday, 10 December. Key Takeaway: If the acquisition materialises, the buyer – either OCBC Singapore or CIMB Malaysia – could consolidate PNBN into their existing banking unit, i.e., Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) if bought by CIMB Malaysia, or Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) if bought by OCBC Singapore. Indonesian banking regulations require a single‑presence policy, meaning a controlling shareholder may own only one bank or multiple banks under a consolidation scheme (merger, absorption, integration, or a Joint Business Group). On the day of the report, PNBN shares closed up 5.8% at IDR 2,010 per share.

marketNews.title: EMTK Again Buys 68 Million Shares of SCMA
marketNews.content:
EMTK (Elang Mahkota Teknologi) purchased 68 million shares of SCMA (Surya Citra Media) at IDR 144 per share between 6‑9 December 2024, amounting to a total transaction value of IDR 9.8 billion. After this transaction, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA increased from 61.09% to 61.18%. Previously, EMTK bought 87 million shares (0.12%) of SCMA at IDR 137 per share on 4‑5 December 2024.

$BREN: Indirect controller of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, bought 1.1 million shares of BREN at an average price of IDR 7,470 per share on 5 December 2024, total value about IDR 8.2 billion. After the transaction, Prajogo Pangestu’s ownership in BREN rose from 0.09701% to 0.09783%.

$BMRI: Head of Investor Relations at Bank Mandiri, Laurensius Teiseran, said the bank aims to keep credit growth above the industry average in 2025, without providing further details. Bank Indonesia targets credit growth of 11‑13% YoY for 2025. Laurensius noted that a declining interest‑rate trend could positively affect credit demand.

$UNVR: Unilever Indonesia announced that three directors – Vivek Agarwal, Ainul Yaqin, and Hernie Raharja – have submitted resignations. Major shareholders plan to propose Neeraj Lal, Vandana Suri, and Alejandro Meinardo Santos Concha as new directors. The proposal will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 14 January 2025.

$EXCL: Bloomberg reported that the controllers of XL Axiata and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) are close to reaching a merger agreement, with transaction details likely to be announced later this week. Bloomberg sources said discussions are ongoing and could be delayed.

$FILM: Indirect controller and President Director of MD Entertainment, Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi, sold approximately 485 million shares of FILM at an average price of IDR 2,600 per share on 3 December 2024, total value about IDR 1.3 trillion, aimed at providing space for a strategic investor. After the sale, Punjabi’s ownership fell from 16.82% to 11.92%.

$INDY: Indika Energy, through its subsidiaries PT Interport Mandiri Utama and PT Interport Mandiri Abadi, signed an agreement to acquire 100% of PT Pahala Globalindo Energi for IDR 7.2 billion. PT Pahala Globalindo Energi operates in fuel trading. INDY stated the acquisition supports its diversification strategy.

$TCPI: Transcoal Pacific announced the sale of one motor vessel and one barge for IDR 24 billion to a non‑affiliated party, intended for fleet renewal.

$TOTL: Total Bangun Persada’s Company Secretary, Anggie S. Sidharta, said the company recorded new contracts worth IDR 4.67 trillion for the 11‑month period ending November 2024, 104% of the 2024 target of IDR 4.5 trillion. Anggie added that TOTL will remain prudent in maintaining positive cash flow in 2025, considering geopolitical tensions, inflation, and the upcoming increase of VAT to 12% in 2025.

The Chinese Politburo announced that China will adopt a "relatively loose" monetary policy in 2025, the first such stance since 2010, to support recovery from the global financial crisis. The Politburo also said the government will stabilize stock and property markets, boost consumption, and expand domestic demand. Morgan Stanley economists said the statement represents the most aggressive stimulus tone in a decade, though implementation remains uncertain.

Indonesia’s Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs Secretary, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said the government plans to continue the government‑funded VAT (DTP) for property and the government‑funded luxury tax (PPnBM DTP) for electric vehicles. The regulations are being prepared by the Ministry of Finance and are expected to be released by the end of 2024. The Vice Chairman of the Indonesian Employers Association, Sanny Iskandar, welcomed the plan but urged a longer subsidy duration for maximum impact.

DealStreetAsia reported that the Djarum Group has acquired 85% of PT Griya Miesejati, operator of Bakmi GM, in a transaction valued at IDR 2‑2.4 trillion. The group’s Corporate Communication Manager, Budi Darmawan, did not deny the report but declined further comment.

Indonesia’s Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said the government will not import rice, corn for consumption or feed, salt, and sugar in 2025, claiming national rice stocks are safe at over 8 million tons.

$HUMI: Humpuss Maritim Internasional, through its subsidiary PT Humpuss Transportasi Curah, announced the purchase of one tugboat and one barge for IDR 24 billion from a non‑affiliated party, financed 70% by bank debt and 30% internally, to develop its subsidiary.

$LPCK: Lippo Cikarang plans a rights issue of approximately 2.97 billion new shares at an execution price of IDR 500 per share, resulting in a dilution of 52.61%. The maximum proceeds are about IDR 1.5 trillion, intended for capital injection into its subsidiary PT Mahkota Sentosa Utama and working capital. The rights will trade cum on the regular market and be negotiated on 4 February 2025, with trading expected between 10‑14 February 2025.

$KKGI: Resource Alam Indonesia announced a revision of the interim dividend ratio from 190:3 to 10,000:53, reducing the treasury share dividend from IDR 61.2 billion to IDR 15.3 billion. The cum‑date remains 30 December 2024, with distribution on 17 January 2025. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 18 December 2024.

$SULI: Indirect controller and President Director of SLJ Global, Amir Sunarko, bought approximately 105.3 million shares of SULI at an average price of IDR 154 per share on 5 December 2024, total transaction value about IDR 16.2 billion. After the purchase, Sunarko’s direct ownership increased from 3.84% to 5.61%.
